channel.title: I hate being a newbie
channel.description: i hate being a newbie :mad: so i got a question where do i start to learn java programming and creating things like private servers any1 got any help coz i dont wanna be a leecher :mad: and i want to have a basic idea what all these things mean

item.title: I hate being a newbie

item.title: I hate being a newbie
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

if you really are commited, then download the Java documentation, and use that with the tutorials that you can get your hands on…the documentation is pretty much a summarization of all the classes/interfaces/methods/etc. in Java…but they would be a bitch to learn from directly, seeing as how huge the collection is

EDIT
and good luck learning Java, i’m doing the same right now

Read full topic

item.title: I hate being a newbie
item.dc:creator: @soul_raever soul raever
item.description:
@soul_raever wrote:

[quote=“iwasinmoparseas101class, post:11, topic:12003”]well you can either use the System.out.println(String str); or you can simply add “\n” to the end of a string:

for example:

System.out.println("Hello");
System.out.println("How are you?");

would display:

Hello
How are you?

and saying:

String str = "Hello \n How are you?";
System.out.println(str);

would display:

[quote]
Hello
How are you?
[/quote][/quote]

thanks soo much

Read full topic

item.title: I hate being a newbie
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

well you can either use the System.out.println(String str); or you can simply add “\n” to the end of a string:

for example:

System.out.println("Hello");
System.out.println("How are you?");

would display:

Hello How are you?

and saying:

String str = "Hello \n How are you?";
System.out.println(str);

would display:

Hello How are you?

item.title: I hate being a newbie

item.description:

Pfft, yea, if you ignore all that shit about reading/writing packets.
[/quote]packets arent that hard, just like any other stream[/quote]Yes, but starting with basic things like text i/o is a much better foundation.

item.title: I hate being a newbie

item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“xerozcheez, post:6, topic:12003”]Actually private servers are great for learning, they mostly use basic java and are fun to do, teach you the basics fairly fast[/quote]if you can read your shitty coding style and wade through all of the poorly coded sections.

[quote=“Kryptizzler, post:7, topic:12003”]Pfft, yea, if you ignore all that shit about reading/writing packets.[/quote]packets arent that hard, just like any other stream

item.title: I hate being a newbie
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

well if you have yet to learn java, I wouldn’t jump into Private Servers just yet. Work on building up the basics, and then progressively get to java’s .net package.

What you are looking to do is basically skip the foreplay and jump on it and hold on as long as you can.
You have to ease it in and coerce it into being what you want it to be.

Read full topic
